title: Can you survive touching lava? - Quora

response.answer_text: Can you survive touching lava? Yes, easily.  Even kids can do it:  (This might be a salamander and thus immune to the heat.)  Contact with molten and semi-molten lava is survivable, too: How Did a 'Lava Bomb' Split a Man's Leg Open? Hawaii Island resident Darryl Clinton has hit by a lava bomb (a flying blob of molten and hardening rock) that nearly snapped his leg off. The damage was primarily mechanical since the impact was brief, and he was walking again within 6 weeks.  Another case of survival from a lava bomb impact, with 23 injuries: Illinois woman injured by lava bomb in Hawaii shares details of terrifying event When considering lava, keep in mind that while it’s hot, lava’s not hotter than a house fire, car fire, or other survivable heat injury source. With quick access to medical care to control infections in the burns, horrific burns from any source are often survivable.

Wouldnt be much different then sticking ya hand in a fire it would cook but lava is hotter then fire so it would cook fast. You might go into shock off the pain and fall into the lava and die. But if you were taken to hospital befor you collaspe then ya probs be fine but without a hand.
